schema.description: The name of the trail for which you want to create a historical event delivery task.

The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the value, but you must make sure that it is unique among different requests.

The token can contain only ASCII characters and can be up to 64 characters in length.

For more information, see [How to ensure idempotence](~~25693~~).

JobId.description: The ID of the historical event delivery task.

CreateDeliveryHistoryJob.title: CreateDeliveryHistoryJob
CreateDeliveryHistoryJob.description:
Limits

*   Make sure that you have created a single-account trail to deliver events to Simple Log Service by calling the [CreateTrail](~~212313~~) operation.
*   Only one data backfill task can run at a time within an Alibaba Cloud account.

This topic provides an example on how to create a data backfill task for a trail named `trail-name`.
CreateDeliveryHistoryJob.requestParamsDescription: For more information about common request parameters, see [Common parameters](~~185885~~).

schema.description:
The name of the trail to be created.\
The name must be 6 to 36 characters in length and must start with a lowercase letter. It can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_).

> Trail names must be unique within the same account.

The OSS bucket to which the trail delivers logs.\
The name must be 3 to 63 characters in length and must start with a lowercase letter or digit. It can contain lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens (-).

> You must specify at least one of the following parameters: OssBucketName, SlsProjectArn, or MaxComputeProjectArn.

The prefix of the file name in the OSS bucket to which the trail delivers logs. This parameter can be left empty.\
The prefix must be 6 to 32 characters in length and must start with a letter. It can contain letters, digits, hyphens (-), forward slashes (/), and underscores (\_).

The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the role that ActionTrail assumes to deliver operation events to the OSS bucket.

- If you do not specify this parameter, ActionTrail creates the required resources by creating a service-linked role. For more information, see [ActionTrail service-linked role](~~169244~~).
- If you specify this parameter and want to deliver events to your current account, you need to grant the ActionTrail service-linked role permission to the RAM role. If you want to deliver events to another account, you need to attach the system policy for event delivery to the RAM role. For more information about cross-account delivery, see [Deliver events from multiple Alibaba Cloud accounts to the same account](~~207462~~).

The ARN of the Simple Log Service project to which the trail delivers logs.

> You must specify at least one of the following parameters: OssBucketName, SlsProjectArn, or MaxComputeProjectArn.

The ARN of the role that ActionTrail assumes to deliver operation events to the Simple Log Service project.

- If you do not specify this parameter, ActionTrail creates the required resources by creating a service-linked role. For more information, see [ActionTrail service-linked role](~~169244~~).
- If you specify this parameter and want to deliver events to your current account, you need to grant the ActionTrail service-linked role permission to the RAM role. If you want to deliver events to another account, you need to attach the system policy for event delivery to the RAM role. For more information about cross-account delivery, see [Deliver events from multiple Alibaba Cloud accounts to the same account](~~207462~~).

The read/write type of the events to be delivered. Valid values:

- Write: write events.
- Read: read events.
- All (default): read and write events.

The region of the trail.\
The default value is All, which indicates that the trail tracks events in all regions.\
You can also specify a specific region. For more information about regions, call the [DescribeRegions](~~213597~~) operation.

Specifies whether to create a multi-account trail. Valid values:

- true: creates a multi-account trail.
- false (default): creates a single-account trail.

The ARN of the MaxCompute project to which the trail delivers logs.

> You must specify at least one of the following parameters: OssBucketName, SlsProjectArn, or MaxComputeProjectArn.

> The name of the MaxCompute project specified in MaxComputeProjectArn must start with the actiontrail\_ prefix.

The ARN of the role that ActionTrail assumes to deliver operation events to the MaxCompute project.

- If you do not specify this parameter, ActionTrail creates the required resources by creating a service-linked role. For more information, see [ActionTrail service-linked role](~~169244~~).
- If you specify this parameter and want to deliver events to your current account, you need to grant the ActionTrail service-linked role permission to the RAM role. If you want to deliver events to another account, you need to attach the system policy for event delivery to the RAM role. For more information about cross-account delivery, see [Deliver events from multiple Alibaba Cloud accounts to the same account](~~207462~~).

EventRW.description: The read/write type of the events to be delivered.

HomeRegion.description: The home region of the trail.

MaxComputeProjectArn.description: The ARN of the MaxCompute project to which the trail delivers logs.

MaxComputeWriteRoleArn.description: The ARN of the role that ActionTrail assumes to deliver operation events to the MaxCompute project.

OssKeyPrefix.description: The prefix of the file name in the OSS bucket.

OssWriteRoleArn.description: The ARN of the role that ActionTrail assumes to deliver operation events to the OSS bucket.

SlsProjectArn.description: The ARN of the Simple Log Service project to which the trail delivers logs.

SlsWriteRoleArn.description: The ARN of the role that ActionTrail assumes to deliver operation events to the Simple Log Service project.

CreateTrail.title: CreateTrail
CreateTrail.description:
> Trails created through the API are in the **shutdown** state by default. You need to call the [StartLogging](~~432246~~) operation to enable the trail before ActionTrail can deliver operation events to the target cloud product.

### Prerequisites

Before you create a trail, ensure that you have completed at least one of the following storage configurations:

- Deliver to Object Storage Service (OSS)

  Make sure you have activated Object Storage Service and created a bucket.
- Deliver to Simple Log Service

  Make sure you have activated Simple Log Service and created a log project.

  > When you create a trail, ActionTrail automatically creates a Logstore named `actiontrail_<trail name>` in the target log project. This Logstore prohibits other data from being written to ensure the accuracy of audit data.
- Deliver to MaxCompute

  Make sure you have activated MaxCompute.

  > When you create a trail, ActionTrail automatically creates a project named `actiontrail_<account ID>` in project management. This project prohibits other data from being written to ensure the accuracy of audit data.

### Usage notes

This topic provides an example of creating a single-account trail named `trail-test` that delivers operation events to an OSS bucket named `audit-log`.
CreateTrail.summary: ActionTrail records events for each Alibaba Cloud account for the last 90 days by default. To track events that occurred more than 90 days ago, you can create a trail to deliver operation events to Object Storage Service (OSS), Simple Log Service, or MaxCompute for event analysis.

schema.description: The name of the template. You can enter a partial template name to retrieve all matching templates. DescribeResourceLifeCycleEvents.summary: This operation queries the lifecycle events for a specific resource.

schema.description: The name of the Alibaba Cloud service.
The resource type.

Data.description:
The lifecycle event data.
This parameter is returned as a JSON-serialized string that contains the hierarchical data of lifecycle event categories. Use a standard JSON deserialization tool to parse the string into an array of objects.
Data.example: [{"children":[{"children":[{"label":"Create Events","labelEn":"Create Events","value":"Create,CreateInstance,RunInstances"},{"label":"Delete Events","labelEn":"Delete Events","value":"DeleteInstance,DeleteInstances,Release"}],"label":"ECS Instance","labelEn":"ECS Instance","value":"ACS::ECS::Instance"}],"label":"Elastic Compute Service","labelEn":"Elastic Compute Service","value":"Ecs"}]

schema.description: The scenario ID.
The page number. The default value is 1.
The maximum number of entries to return on each page. The default value is 20.

PageSize.description: The maximum number of entries returned on each page.

Charts.description:
The list of dashboards. This parameter is deprecated.

> This parameter is deprecated and no longer returns valid data. The return value is always an empty array `[]`. Stop using this parameter and remove dependencies on it from your code.

Description.example: Events of Console Logons by Using Cloud Account

Params.description:
The query condition parameters.
This parameter is returned as a JSON-serialized string. The content is a structured list of query conditions. Use a standard JSON deserialization tool in your programming language to parse the string into an array of objects.

Sql.example: select "event.userIdentity.accountId" as account_id, count(1) as cnt group by account_id limit 1000

TemplateName.example: Events of Console Logons by Using Cloud Account

GetAccessKeyLastUsedEvents.title: GetAccessKeyLastUsedEvents
GetAccessKeyLastUsedEvents.summary: Queries the information about the most recent events that are generated when a specified AccessKey pair is called to access Alibaba Cloud services.
GetAccessKeyLastUsedEvents.description: You can call this operation to query only the information about the most recent events that are generated within 400 days after February 1, 2022 when a specified AccessKey pair is called to access Alibaba Cloud services. For more information about supported events, see [Alibaba Cloud services and events that are supported by the AccessKey pair audit feature](~~419214~~). Data is updated at 1-hour intervals, which can cause query latency. We recommend that you do not change an AccessKey pair unless required.

schema.description: The AccessKey ID.

AccountId.description: The ID of the Alibaba Cloud account.

AccountType.description: The type of the account to which the AccessKey pair belongs.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the account to which the AccessKey pair belongs.

ServiceName.description: The Alibaba Cloud service that was last accessed.

ServiceNameCn.description: The Chinese name of the Alibaba Cloud service that was last accessed.

ServiceNameEn.description: The English name of the Alibaba Cloud service that was last accessed.

UsedTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the AccessKey pair was last called.

UserName.description:
The name of the account to which the AccessKey pair belongs.

If the value of the AccountType parameter is root-account, the value of the UserName parameter is root. If the value of the AccountType parameter is ram-user, the value of the UserName parameter is the name of a RAM user.

400.errorMessage: The request signature does not conform to Alibaba Cloud standards.
400.description: The request signature does not conform to Alibaba Cloud standards.

GetAccessKeyLastUsedInfo.title: GetAccessKeyLastUsedInfo
GetAccessKeyLastUsedInfo.summary: Queries the information about the most recent call of a specified AccessKey pair.
GetAccessKeyLastUsedInfo.description: You can call this operation to query only the information about the most recent call of a specified AccessKey pair within 400 days after February 1, 2022. Data is updated at 1-hour intervals, which can cause query latency. We recommend that you do not change an AccessKey pair unless required.

GetAccessKeyLastUsedProducts.title: GetAccessKeyLastUsedProducts
GetAccessKeyLastUsedProducts.summary: Queries the information about the Alibaba Cloud services that are most recently accessed by using a specified AccessKey pair.
GetAccessKeyLastUsedProducts.description: You can call this operation to query only the information about Alibaba Cloud services that are most recently accessed by using a specified AccessKey pair within 400 days after February 1, 2022. Data is updated at 1-hour intervals, which can cause query latency. We recommend that you do not change an AccessKey pair unless required.

*   Valid values: 0 to 100.
*   Default value: 20.

Data is updated at 1-hour intervals, which can cause query latency. We recommend that you do not change an AccessKey pair unless required.

GetGlobalEventsStorageRegion.title: GetGlobalEventsStorageRegion

GetGlobalEventsStorageRegion.summary: Queries the region where global events are stored.

AccountId.description: The ID of the Alibaba Cloud account.

ColumnsSchema.description:
The details of the governance resource.

This parameter contains the detailed configurations of all compliant resources for the governance item. This parameter is returned only if a resource instance exists.

GovernanceItem.description: The governance item. This indicates a specific category of compliance check.

GovernanceScore.description: The compliance score for the governance item. The value ranges from 0 to 100.

GovernanceMetrics.description: A collection of governance items that contain multiple compliance assessment dimensions.

schema.description: Schema of Response

GetGovernanceMetrics.title: GetGovernanceMetrics
GetGovernanceMetrics.summary: Queries the governance metrics of ActionTrail.

schema.description:
The name of the trail.

The name must be 6 to 36 characters in length. The name must start with a lowercase letter and can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_).

> The name must be unique within your Alibaba Cloud account.

Specifies whether to query the status of a multi-account trail. Valid values:

*   true: Query the status of a multi-account trail.
*   false: Query the status of a single-account trail. It is the default value.

StartLoggingTime.description: The time when logging was last enabled for the trail.

LatestDeliveryError.description: The log of the last failed delivery.
LatestDeliveryError.example: write sls failed, exception: the parent of sub user must be project owner, itemscount: 1

StopLoggingTime.description: The time when logging was last disabled for the trail.

IsLogging.description:
Indicates whether logging is enabled for the trail. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

LatestDeliveryTime.description: The most recent time when an event was delivered by the trail.

LatestDeliveryLogServiceError.description: The log of the last failed delivery to Log Service.
LatestDeliveryLogServiceError.example: write sls failed, exception: the parent of sub user must be project owner, itemscount: 1

LatestDeliveryLogServiceTime.description: The most recent time when an event was delivered to Log Service.

OssBucketStatus.description:
Indicates whether the destination Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket is available. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

SlsLogStoreStatus.description:
Indicates whether the destination Log Service Logstore is available. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

ListDeliveryHistoryJobs.title: ListDeliveryHistoryJobs
ListDeliveryHistoryJobs.summary: Queries a list of data backfill tasks.
ListDeliveryHistoryJobs.description: This topic provides an example on how to query a list of data backfill tasks. The returned result shows that a data backfill task with the ID `16602` is used to deliver historical events for a trail named `trail-name` to Simple Log Service.

schema.description:
The token that is used to request the next page of query results.

> The request parameters must be the same as those of the previous request.

The maximum number of results to return.
Valid values: 1 to 50.

The beginning of the time range to retrieve events. The time is in the ISO 8601 format and is in UTC. The format is `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

> You must specify both StartTime and EndTime, or leave both of them empty. If you leave them empty, the default value of StartTime is 7 days before the current time.

The end of the time range to retrieve events. The time is in the ISO 8601 format and is in UTC. The format is `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

> You must specify both StartTime and EndTime, or leave both of them empty. If you leave them empty, the default value of EndTime is the current time.

The order in which events are retrieved. Valid values:

- FORWARD: in chronological order.

- BACKWARD (default): in reverse chronological order.

The lookup condition.

> You can specify one or two lookup conditions at a time. For more information, see [Limits](~~2920829~~).

Key.description: The key of the lookup condition. For more information about valid values, see [Set the LookupAttribute parameter for the LookupEvents operation](~~2920829~~).

Value.description: The value of the lookup condition. For more information about valid values, see [Set the LookupAttribute parameter for the LookupEvents operation](~~2920829~~).

EndTime.description: The end of the time range of the retrieved events.

items.description:
The list of retrieved events.

For more information about the event fields in the list, see [Structure of a management event](~~28819~~).

NextToken.description:
The token that is used to return the next page of query results.

> This parameter is not returned if no more results are available.

StartTime.description: The beginning of the time range of the retrieved events.

LookupEvents.title: LookupEvents
LookupEvents.description: > This operation is not intended for frequent calls. We recommend that you create a trail to deliver events to Simple Log Service (SLS). You can then use the real-time data consumption feature of SLS to retrieve events in near real time. For more information, see [Create a single-account trail](~~28810~~), [Create a multi-account trail](~~160661~~), and [Real-time data consumption](~~28997~~).
LookupEvents.requestParamsDescription: For more information about common request parameters, see [Common parameters](~~185885~~).

UpdateGlobalEventsStorageRegion.title: UpdateGlobalEventsStorageRegion
UpdateGlobalEventsStorageRegion.summary: Specifies the region where you want to store global events.
UpdateGlobalEventsStorageRegion.description:
By default, global events are stored in the Singapore region.

*   To obtain the permissions to call the API operation, you must submit a ticket.
*   Only the China (Hangzhou) region (cn-hangzhou) and the Singapore region (ap-southeast-1) are supported.

schema.description:
The name of the trail whose configurations you want to update.

The name must be 6 to 36 characters in length and can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_). It must start with a lowercase letter.

>  The name must be unique within an Alibaba Cloud account.

The name of the Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket to which you want to deliver events.

The name must be 3 to 63 characters in length. The name must start with a lowercase letter or a digit and can contain lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens (-).

>  Make sure that the bucket exists before you update the configuration of the trail.

The prefix of the files that are stored in the OSS bucket.

The prefix must be 6 to 32 characters in length. The prefix must start with a letter and can contain letters, digits, hyphens (-), forward slashes (/), and underscores (\_).

The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the OSS bucket.

*   If you do not specify this parameter, ActionTrail creates a service-linked role to create the required resources. For more information, see [Manage the service-linked role](~~169244~~).
*   If you specify this parameter, you must grant the permissions of the service-linked role that is assumed by ActionTrail to the RAM role before you can deliver events to your Alibaba Cloud account. If you need to deliver events to other Alibaba Cloud accounts, you must attach the permission policy that is used to grant permissions related to event delivery to the RAM role. For more information about how to deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts, see [Deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts](~~207462~~).
The ARN of the Log Service project to which you want to deliver events.

The ARN of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the Log Service project.

*   If you do not specify this parameter, ActionTrail creates a service-linked role to create the corresponding resource. For more information, see [Manage the service-linked role](~~169244~~).
*   If you specify this parameter, you must grant the permissions of the service-linked role that is assumed by ActionTrail to the RAM role before you can deliver events to your Alibaba Cloud account. If you need to deliver events to other Alibaba Cloud accounts, you must attach the permission policy that is used to grant permissions related to event delivery to the RAM role. For more information about how to deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts, see [Deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts](~~207462~~).

The read/write type of the events to be delivered. Valid values:

*   Write: write events. It is the default value.
*   Read: read events.
*   All: read and write events.

The region of the trail.

*   The default value is All, which indicates that the trail delivers events from all regions.

You can also specify specific regions. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~213597~~) operation to query all the supported regions.

The ARN of the MaxCompute project to which you want to deliver events.

>  The name of the MaxCompute project must be prefixed with actiontrail\_.

The ARN of the role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the destination Simple Log Service project.

*   If you do not specify this parameter, ActionTrail creates a service-linked role to create the required resources. For more information, see [Manage the service-linked role](~~169244~~).
*   If you specify this parameter and deliver events to the current account, you must grant the RAM role the permissions on the service-linked role for ActionTrail. If you want to deliver events to other accounts, you must attach a system policy to the RAM role. For more information about how to deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts, see [Deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts](~~207462~~).

SlsProjectArn.description: The ARN of the Log Service project to which events are to be delivered.

OssWriteRoleArn.description: The ARN of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the OSS bucket.

EventRW.description: The read/write type of the events to be delivered.

HomeRegion.description: The home region of the trail.

OssKeyPrefix.description: The prefix of the log files to be stored in the destination OSS bucket.

OssBucketName.description: The name of the OSS bucket.

SlsWriteRoleArn.description: The ARN of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail is to deliver events to the Log Service project.

TrailRegion.description: The one or more regions from which the trail delivers events.

MaxComputeProjectArn.description: ARN of the Big Data Compute Service project for tracking delivery.

MaxComputeWriteRoleArn.description: The ARN of the role that Operation Audit assumes when delivering operation events to the Big Data Compute Service project.
